qas.question: What is one measure taken to keep society safe from improper pesticide use?
What is a choice that users of pesticides can make that will lower risks?
What is one country that has sucessfully used IPM?
Biological and botanical derivatives have what positive effects?
Who has the ability to make the choice of using less harmful pesticides?
What is one country that still uses chemical pesticides heavily?

plausible_answers.text: Indonesia, China, Bangladesh, the U.S., Australia, and Mexico

qas.question: What countries risk the environment by using pesticides often?
What has pesticide safety education reduced in Australia?
What are two classifications of pests in an ecosystem?
In what country are ecosystems most at risk from pesticide misuse?

context: Pesticides safety education and <a0_0>pesticide applicator regulation<a0_0/> are designed to protect the public from pesticide misuse, but do not eliminate all misuse. Reducing the use of pesticides and <a1_0>choosing less toxic pesticides<a1_0/> may reduce risks placed on society and the environment from pesticide use. Integrated pest management, the use of multiple approaches to control pests, is becoming widespread and has been used with success in countries such as <b6_0>Indonesia, <b5_0>China<b5_0/>, Bangladesh, the U.S., <a2_0>Australia<a2_0/>, and <b9_0>Mexico<b9_0/><b6_0/>. IPM attempts to recognize the more widespread impacts of an action on an ecosystem, so that natural balances are not upset. New pesticides are being developed, including <b8_0>biological and botanical<b8_0/> derivatives and alternatives that are thought to <a3_0>reduce <b7_0>health and environmental risks<b7_0/><a3_0/>. In addition, <a4_0>applicators<a4_0/> are being encouraged to consider alternative controls and adopt methods that reduce the use of chemical pesticides.
